verses.verse: These also are proverbs <WH4912> of Solomon, <WH8010> which the men <WH582> of Hezekiah <WH2396> king <WH4428> of Judah <WH3063> copied out. <WH6275>
It is the glory <WH3519> of God <WH430> to conceal <WH5641> a thing, <WH1697> but the glory <WH3519> of kings <WH4428> is to search out <WH2713> a matter. <WH1697>
As the heavens <WH8064> for height, <WH7312> and the earth <WH776> for depth, <WH6011> so the hearts <WH3820> of kings <WH4428> are unsearchable. <WH2714>
Take away <WH1898> the dross <WH5509> from the silver, <WH3701> and material <WH3627> comes out <WH3318> for the refiner; <WH6884>
Take away <WH1898> the wicked <WH7563> from the king <WH4428>'s presence, <WH6440> and his throne <WH3678> will be established <WH3559> in righteousness. <WH6664>
Don't <WH1921> exalt yourself in the presence <WH6440> of the king, <WH4428> or claim <WH5975> a place <WH4725> among great men; <WH1419>

for it is better <WH2896> that it be said <WH559> to you, <WH5927> "Come up here, <WH8213>" than that you should be put lower in the presence <WH6440> of the prince, <WH5081> whom your eyes <WH5869> have seen. <WH7200>
Don't <WH4118> be hasty in bringing <WH3318> charges <WH7378> to court. <WH6213> What will you do in the end <WH319> when your neighbor <WH7453> shames you? <WH3637>
Debate <WH7378> your case <WH7379> with your neighbor, <WH7453> and don't <WH1540> betray the confidence <WH5475> of another; <WH312>
lest one who hears <WH8085> it put you to shame, <WH2616> and your bad reputation <WH1681> never depart. <WH7725>
A word <WH1697> fitly <WH212> spoken <WH1696> is like apples <WH8598> of gold <WH2091> in settings <WH4906> of silver. <WH3701>
As an earring <WH5141> of gold, <WH2091> and an ornament <WH2481> of fine gold, <WH3800> so is a wise <WH2450> reprover <WH3198> to an obedient <WH8085> ear. <WH241>

As the cold <WH6793> of snow <WH7950> in the time <WH3117> of harvest, <WH7105> so is a faithful <WH539> messenger <WH6735> to those who send <WH7971> him; <WH7725> for he refreshes the soul <WH5315> of his masters. <WH113>
As clouds <WH5387> and wind <WH7307> without rain, <WH1653> so is he <WH376> who boasts <WH1984> of gifts <WH4991> deceptively. <WH8267>
By <WH753> patience <WH639> a ruler <WH7101> is persuaded. <WH6601> A soft <WH7390> tongue <WH3956> breaks <WH7665> the bone. <WH1634>
Have you found <WH4672> honey? <WH1706> Eat <WH398> as much as is sufficient <WH1767> for you, <WH7646> lest you eat too much, and vomit it. <WH6958>
Let your foot <WH7272> be seldom <WH3365> in your neighbor <WH7453>'s house, <WH1004> lest he be weary <WH7646> of you, <WH8130> and hate you.
A man <WH376> who gives <WH6030> false <WH8267> testimony <WH5707> against his neighbor <WH7453> is like a club, <WH4650> a sword, <WH2719> or a sharp <WH8150> arrow. <WH2671>
Confidence <WH4009> in someone unfaithful <WH898> in time <WH3117> of trouble <WH6869> is like a bad <WH7465> tooth, <WH8127> or a lame <WH4154> foot. <WH7272>

As one who takes away <WH5710> a garment <WH899> in cold <WH7135> weather, <WH3117> or vinegar <WH2558> on soda, <WH5427> so is one who sings <WH7891> songs <WH7892> to a heavy <WH7451> heart. <WH3820>
If your enemy <WH8130> is hungry, <WH7457> give him food <WH3899> to eat. <WH398> If he is thirsty, <WH6771> give him water <WH4325> to drink: <WH8248>
for you will heap <WH2846> coals of fire <WH1513> on his head, <WH7218> and Yahweh <WH3068> will reward you. <WH7999>
The north <WH6828> wind <WH7307> brings forth <WH2342> rain: <WH1653> so a backbiting <WH5643> tongue <WH3956> brings an angry <WH2194> face. <WH6440>
It is better <WH2896> to dwell <WH3427> in the corner <WH6438> of the housetop, <WH1406> than to share <WH2267> a house <WH1004> with a contentious <WH4079> woman. <WH802>
Like cold <WH7119> water <WH4325> to a thirsty <WH5889> soul, <WH5315> so is good <WH2896> news <WH8052> from a far <WH4801> country. <WH776>
Like a muddied <WH7515> spring, <WH4599> and a polluted <WH7843> well, <WH4726> so is a righteous <WH6662> man who gives <WH4131> way before <WH6440> the wicked. <WH7563>
It is not good <WH2896> to eat <WH398> much <WH7235> honey; <WH1706> nor is it honorable <WH3519> to seek <WH2714> one <WH3519>'s own honor.
Like a city <WH5892> that is broken down <WH6555> and without walls <WH2346> is a man <WH376> whose spirit <WH7307> is without restraint. <WH4623>
